item.title: JenNonna add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by John August
item.description: "A little nonsense now and then, Is cherished by the wisest men." -- John August

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "Our hearts have been made for you, O God, and they shall never rest until they rest in you." -- St. Augustine

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Thomas à Kempis
item.description: "Jesus has now many lovers of the heavenly kingdom but few bearers of His cross." -- Thomas à Kempis

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Gerard Manley Hopkins
JenNonna add a quote by Mother Angelica
item.description: "Faith is one foot on the ground, one foot in the air, and a queasy feeling in the stomach." -- Mother Angelica

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Live simply so others may simply live." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "At the end of life we will not be judged by how many diplomas we have received, how much money we have made, how many great things we have done. We will be judged by "I was hungry, and you gave me something to eat, I was naked and you clothed me. I was homeless, and you took me in." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "A life not lived for others is not a life." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Teresa of Avila
item.description: "It is love alone that gives worth to all things." -- St. Teresa of Avila

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "Start by doing what is necessary, then what is possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "The deeds you do may be the only sermon some persons will hear today" -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis of Assisi
item.description: "Preach the Gospel at all times, and when necessary, use words." -- St. Francis of Assisi

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis de Sales
item.description: "The measure of love is to love without measure." -- St. Francis de Sales

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by St. Francis of Assisi
item.description:
"Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love, Where there is injury, pardon; Where there is doubt, faith; Where there is despair, hope; Where there is darkness, light; And where there is sadness, joy.
O Divine Master, grant that I may not so much seek to be consoled as to console, to be understood as to understand, to be loved, as to love.
For it is in giving that we receive, It is in pardoning that we are pardoned, and it is in dying that we are born to eternal life." -- St. Francis of Assisi

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Nothing is impossible for him who believes." -- Anonymous

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Whom have I in heaven but you and earth possesses nothing I desire besides you" -Psalm 73:25" -- Anonymous

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Kallistos Ware
item.description: "In the Christian context, we do not mean by a "mystery" merely that which is baffling and mysterious, an enigma or insoluble problem. A mystery is, on the contrary, something that is revealed for our understanding, but which we never understand exhaustively because it leads into the depth or the darkness of God. The eyes are closed—but they are also opened." -- Kallistos Ware

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Seraphim Rose
item.description: "When conversion takes place, the process of revelation occurs in a very simple way — a person is in need, he suffers, and then somehow the other world opens up. The more you are in suffering and difficulties and are 'desperate' for God, the more He is going to come to your aid, reveal Who He is and show you the way out..." -- Seraphim Rose

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If grace perfects nature it must expand all our natures into the full richness of the diversity which God intended when He made them, and Heaven will display far more variety than Hell. . . a Greek Orthodox mass I once attended. . . seemed to [have] no prescribed behaviour for the congregation. . . the beauty was that nobody took notice of what anyone else was doing." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: JenNonna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman
